storyTitle: As Employee, I want to submit schedule change requests to achieve timely and accurate schedule updates

testCases.title: Validate successful schedule change request submission with valid data
preconditions: Employee is registered in the system with valid credentials
Employee is logged into the scheduling system
Employee has active employment status
Schedule change request page is accessible
Test document file (under 5MB) is available for attachment

steps.action: Navigate to schedule change request page from the main dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Schedule change request form is displayed with all mandatory fields visible (date, time, reason) and optional attachment field

steps.action: Enter valid future date in the date field (e.g., tomorrow's date in correct format)
steps.expectedResult: Date field accepts the input without validation errors and displays the date in the correct format

steps.action: Enter valid time in the time field (e.g., 09:00 AM)
steps.expectedResult: Time field accepts the input without validation errors and displays the time in the correct format

steps.action: Enter a valid reason for the schedule change in the reason field (e.g., 'Medical appointment')
steps.expectedResult: Reason field accepts the text input without character limit errors

steps.action: Click on the attachment button and select a valid document file (PDF, DOC, or image) under 5MB
steps.expectedResult: File is successfully attached and file name is displayed in the attachment area without errors

steps.action: Click the Submit button to submit the schedule change request
steps.expectedResult: Request is saved to the ScheduleChangeRequests table, confirmation message is displayed with request ID, and page shows success status

postconditions: Schedule change request is stored in the database with status 'Pending'
Request appears in the employee's request history
Employee remains on confirmation page or is redirected to dashboard
Attached document is stored in the system and linked to the request

testCases.title: Verify rejection of submission with missing mandatory fields
preconditions: Employee is registered in the system with valid credentials
Employee is logged into the scheduling system
Employee has active employment status
Schedule change request page is accessible

steps.action: Navigate to schedule change request page from the main dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Schedule change request form is displayed with all mandatory fields visible and marked with asterisks or 'required' indicators

steps.action: Leave the date field empty and move focus to the next field
steps.expectedResult: Real-time validation highlights the date field with red border or error indicator showing 'Date is required'

steps.action: Leave the time field empty and move focus to the next field
steps.expectedResult: Real-time validation highlights the time field with red border or error indicator showing 'Time is required'

steps.action: Leave the reason field empty
steps.expectedResult: Real-time validation highlights the reason field with red border or error indicator showing 'Reason is required'

steps.action: Attempt to submit the form by clicking the Submit button with all mandatory fields empty
steps.expectedResult: Submission is blocked, form does not submit, error messages are displayed for all missing mandatory fields, and focus moves to the first empty required field

steps.action: Fill in only the date field with valid data and attempt to submit again
steps.expectedResult: Submission is still blocked, error messages remain for time and reason fields, date field error is cleared

postconditions: No data is saved to the database
Employee remains on the schedule change request form
All validation error messages are visible
Form retains any data that was entered

testCases.title: Test file attachment size validation
preconditions: Employee is registered in the system with valid credentials
Employee is logged into the scheduling system
Schedule change request page is accessible
Test file larger than 5MB is available (e.g., 6MB PDF)
Test file smaller than 5MB is available (e.g., 3MB PDF)

steps.action: Navigate to schedule change request page and locate the file attachment section
steps.expectedResult: File attachment button is visible with indication of maximum file size limit (5MB)

steps.action: Click on the attachment button and select a file larger than 5MB (e.g., 6MB file)
steps.expectedResult: Validation error message is displayed stating 'File size exceeds maximum limit of 5MB' and file is not attached to the form

steps.action: Verify that the attachment field remains empty after the error
steps.expectedResult: No file name is displayed in the attachment area and the field shows as empty

steps.action: Click on the attachment button again and select a file smaller than 5MB (e.g., 3MB file)
steps.expectedResult: File is accepted without errors, file name is displayed in the attachment area with file size indicator

steps.action: Fill in all mandatory fields (date, time, reason) with valid data
steps.expectedResult: All fields accept valid data without validation errors

steps.action: Submit the form with the valid attachment by clicking the Submit button
steps.expectedResult: Submission succeeds, confirmation message is displayed with request ID, and attached file is successfully linked to the request

postconditions: Schedule change request is saved in the database with the valid attachment
File under 5MB is stored in the system storage
File over 5MB was rejected and not stored
Employee sees confirmation of successful submission

storyTitle: As Employee, I want to view the status and history of my schedule change requests to track progress

testCases.title: View schedule change requests dashboard
preconditions: Employee is registered in the system with valid credentials
Employee has previously submitted at least 3 schedule change requests with different statuses (pending, approved, rejected)
Database contains approval history with timestamps and comments for at least one request
Employee is logged into the scheduling system
Dashboard page is accessible and functional

steps.action: Employee logs into the system using valid credentials
steps.expectedResult: Employee is successfully authenticated and redirected to the main dashboard or home page

steps.action: Navigate to the schedule change requests dashboard by clicking on 'My Requests' or 'Schedule Requests' menu option
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard page loads and displays a list of all submitted schedule change requests with columns showing request ID, date, time, reason, and current status

steps.action: Verify that all previously submitted requests are visible in the list
steps.expectedResult: All requests submitted by the logged-in employee are displayed with accurate information including submission date and current status (pending, approved, or rejected)

steps.action: Select a request from the list by clicking on it to view detailed approval history
steps.expectedResult: Detailed history panel or page opens showing complete approval workflow with timestamps, approver names, actions taken (submitted, reviewed, approved/rejected), and any comments provided by approvers

steps.action: Return to the dashboard list view and locate the filter section
steps.expectedResult: Filter options are visible including status filter dropdown with options: All, Pending, Approved, Rejected

steps.action: Select 'Approved' from the status filter dropdown
steps.expectedResult: The request list updates immediately to show only requests with 'Approved' status, other status requests are hidden from view

steps.action: Clear the status filter and apply a date range filter to find requests from the last 30 days
steps.expectedResult: Filtered list updates to display only requests submitted within the specified date range, showing accurate results

postconditions: Employee remains logged into the system
Dashboard displays filtered or unfiltered list based on last action
No data is modified in the database
Filter selections are retained during the session

testCases.title: Ensure access restriction to own requests
preconditions: Two employee accounts exist in the system: Employee A and Employee B
Employee A is logged into the system
Employee B has submitted schedule change requests with known request IDs
Direct URL format for accessing requests is known (e.g., /requests/{requestId})
Access control and authentication mechanisms are active

steps.action: While logged in as Employee A, navigate to Employee A's own schedule change requests dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard displays only Employee A's requests successfully

steps.action: Note the URL structure and request ID format from Employee A's requests
steps.expectedResult: URL structure is visible in the browser address bar (e.g., /requests/dashboard or /requests/{requestId})

steps.action: Manually modify the URL in the browser to attempt accessing Employee B's request by entering Employee B's known request ID (e.g., change /requests/123 to /requests/456 where 456 belongs to Employee B)
steps.expectedResult: System detects unauthorized access attempt and displays 'Access Denied' or '403 Forbidden' error message

steps.action: Attempt to access Employee B's requests dashboard by manipulating the userId parameter in the URL (e.g., /requests?userId=EmployeeB)
steps.expectedResult: System validates user identity, denies access, and displays error message 'You do not have permission to view this content' or redirects to Employee A's own dashboard

steps.action: Verify that Employee A is still logged in and can access their own requests normally
steps.expectedResult: Employee A can successfully navigate back to their own dashboard and view their own requests without any issues

postconditions: Employee A remains logged into the system
No unauthorized access to Employee B's data occurred
Security logs record the unauthorized access attempts
Employee A can only view their own requests

testCases.title: Dashboard performance under normal load
preconditions: Employee account exists with 100+ schedule change requests in the database
Test data includes requests with various statuses and approval histories
Network conditions are stable and normal
Browser cache is cleared to ensure accurate load time measurement
Performance monitoring tools or browser developer tools are available to measure load time
Employee is logged into the scheduling system

steps.action: Open browser developer tools and navigate to the Network tab to monitor page load performance
steps.expectedResult: Developer tools are open and ready to capture network activity and timing metrics

steps.action: Clear browser cache and refresh the page to ensure clean test conditions
steps.expectedResult: Cache is cleared and page is ready for fresh load test

steps.action: Navigate to the schedule change requests dashboard that contains 100+ requests
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard begins loading and network activity is captured in developer tools

steps.action: Measure the total page load time from initial request to complete rendering of all 100+ requests in the list
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard loads completely within 2 seconds, all request records are visible, status indicators are displayed, and page is fully interactive

steps.action: Verify that all UI elements are rendered correctly including headers, filters, pagination controls, and request data
steps.expectedResult: All dashboard components are properly displayed, no missing data, no layout issues, and all interactive elements are functional

steps.action: Test dashboard responsiveness by applying a filter to the 100+ requests
steps.expectedResult: Filter is applied and results are updated within 1 second, maintaining good performance

steps.action: Record the actual load time from the Network tab (DOMContentLoaded and Load events)
steps.expectedResult: Recorded metrics confirm that dashboard loaded within the 2-second performance requirement

postconditions: Dashboard remains functional and responsive
All 100+ requests are accessible and viewable
Performance metrics are documented for future reference
Employee can continue to interact with the dashboard normally
